ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to present on news articles and read articles for understanding the general idea rather than every word.
I improved my ability to read Arabic news sources. I am now able to prepare a lengthy oral presentation on current events more easily. I practiced advanced academic translation for the first time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
The strength is that this class helped me use and improve my Arabic. I learned new vocab and enjoyed watching the movies/reading the stories that we did in class. Class was engaging. 
One weakness is that doing the same thing (same structure) can get a bit repetitive at times.
I liked the news presentations and the stories we read. I wish we had been forced to speak more in class!

The course only meets three times per week, including a section, as compared with five days per week for previous levels. Less class time means that we are not able to cover as much material. I wish that we had spent a bit more time on grammar review and general conversation practice. I liked reading Arabic short stories, but I would have enjoyed discussing them more in class. The students in the course had a wide range of Arabic experience and ability, which made it hard for all lessons to be accessible and interesting for everyone. Section was fun, but I think I would prefer spending Fridays with Professor Aziz.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, take it if you want to continue learning/improving your Arabic

Yes, this is a necessary course to take if you want to become very proficient in Arabic. I do feel that my language skills (particularly my ability to read about and discuss current events) have improved this semester.
